perturbation.original_text: Royalties shall accrue when the Wireless Products are sold, downloaded or otherwise distributed to the end user, whichever first occurs, and shall become payable upon receipt by Licensee. "Gross Receipts" shall mean all monies received by or credited to Licensee for download of the Wireless Products by end users less only monies actually retained by the CSPs (the "Deductions").
perturbation.changed_text: Royalties shall accrue when the Wireless Products are sold, downloaded or otherwise distributed to the end user, whichever first occurs, and shall become payable upon receipt by Licensee. "Gross Receipts" shall mean all monies received by or credited to Licensee for download of the Wireless Products by end users.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the parenthetical definition of 'Deductions' (monies retained by CSPs), this clause now contradicts later sections that reference 'Deductions' in the royalty calculation. This creates ambiguity about how Gross Receipts are actually calculated, affecting the royalties owed.

perturbation.original_text: The News America Group provides consumers with an opportunity to choose whether the business unit that collects their personally identifiable information may use it for purposes that are other than those for which the information was submitted, and whether the information may be shared with third parties.
perturbation.changed_text: The News America Group provides consumers with general guidelines regarding how their personally identifiable information may be used.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clear statement that consumers have the 'opportunity to choose' regarding the use and sharing of their data, and replacing it with 'general guidelines,' the modified text contradicts section 8(f) that asserts Licensee’s compliance with Fox’s Internet Privacy Policy. It creates uncertainty about whether user consent is required for data use.

perturbation.original_text: For the Term of this Agreement, Fox hereby grants to Licensee a right of first negotiation with respect to those theatrical motion pictures released during the Term of this Agreement (in addition to the Properties identified in Exhibit A) in which (i) Fox owns or controls licensing and merchandising rights, for which Fox determines in its sole discretion to grant to any third party any licensing rights for the development and distribution of wireless products, and (ii) which theatrical motion pictures Fox reasonably deems to be a Major Release consistent with its past practices. The Right of First Negotiation shall be exercised as follows. Whenever Fox desires to grant to any third party any licensing rights for a Major Release (each such instance, an "Opportunity"), Fox shall request that Licensee submit a bid regarding the Opportunity. If Licensee intends to exercise its Right of First Negotiation, it must submit a bid in response to Fox's request within 10 business days. If Licensee does submit a bid, both parties shall negotiate in good faith over the bid for a reasonable period of time, not to exceed 10 additional business days. If the parties have not reached agreement in writing regarding the terms and conditions for the exploitation of the Opportunity within said time period, or if Licensee fails to submit a bid in a timely manner, Fox shall be free to accept any bid from any other party with respect to the Opportunity, or Fox shall be free not to exploit the Opportunity at all. Should Licensee choose to exercise its Right of First Negotiation, its floor bid shall be at least US$***** for each Major Release (as defined in Exhibit N).
perturbation.changed_text: For the Term of this Agreement, Fox may grant to Licensee a right to first negotiation with respect to those theatrical motion pictures released during the Term of this Agreement (in addition to the Properties identified in Exhibit A). Fox determines if that first right negotiation would happen, and its conditions.
perturbation.explanation: The text was changed to remove the process of what it means the first right negotiation. Now, the definition creates an uncertainty about it since is not clear how the negotiation will be, and the obligations for both parties.
